title: Learner Agency Empowerment Project in Smart Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and general understanding of elementary social studies curriculum
context.additional_context: Current elementary teachers explore methods for designing and operating smart learning environments to enhance learner autonomy, developing practical classroom implementation plans through project execution

learning_goals: Design a learner-customized feedback system utilizing an adaptive learning platform

Within a week, learners develop 1 social studies project-based learning scenario using one virtual/augmented reality tool (e.g., Zepeto, Unity) and submit a deliverable meeting ≥4 of 5 peer/lecturer evaluation criteria (creativity, feasibility, educational effectiveness, etc.).
Create a rubric to assess learner agency levels through analysis of learning data

Using Google Workspace and Notion, learners create a 100+ learner management strategy document (including 3 role divisions, 2 communication systems, 3 progress tracking methods) within a week and achieve ≥4.0/5.0 on the institution’s evaluation rubric.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
